content.question: Bodnar’s and Ewen’s overall arguments in the excerpts together best support which of the following conclusions?

choices.label: Most Americans embraced the arrival of new immigrants in the late 1800s.
Warfare in Europe was a primary reason for immigration to the United States.
The economic needs and social ambitions of young immigrants could be in conflict.
The demand for inexpensive labor led industrialists to advocate increased immigration.

content.answer: The economic needs and social ambitions of young immigrants could be in conflict.

topic.text: 6.8: Immigration and Migration in the Gilded Age

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Compare the arguments or main ideas of two sources.
